intro: Leucosyke rizalensis, commonly known as the Rizalensis tree, is a rare species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Its bark is smooth and grayish, with a distinctive aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
